Ref: WB/CD/195/06/11/2014
Ms. Paula Malan Counsellor, Education Embassy of the Republic of Finland Addis Ababa
Dear Ms. Malan:
Re.: Administration Agreement between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Finland and the International Development Association Quality concerning the Multi Donor Trust Fundfor the Ethiopia General Education Improvement Project II (TF No. 072206)
that the 1. The International Development Association ("IDA" or the "Bank") acknowledge the Bank, the "Parties" and Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland (the "Donor", and together with hundred thousand each a "Party") agrees to provide, the maximum sum of nineteen million eight Trust Fund for the Ethiopia General Euros (E19,800,000) (the "Contribution") for the Multi-Donor established for the benefit Education Quality Improvement Project II (TF072206)(the "Trust Fund") with the terms of this of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia ("Recipient") in accordance contribute to the Trust Fund on the Administration Agreement. Other donors are also expected to Agreement. terms and conditions specified in the Annexes and Attachment to this Administration Trust 2. The Contribution shall be used to finance the activities set forth in the "Multi-Donor attached hereto as Annex Fund for the Ethiopia General Education Quality Improvement Project II" with the terms of this 1, and shall be administered by the Bank on behalf of the Donor in accordance hereto as Annex 2 Administration Agreement, including the "Standard Provisions" attached (including the Attachment thereto). schedule and in 3. When making any deposit, the Donor shall instruct its bank to include in its indicating: the information (remittance advice) field of its SWIFT deposit message, information Multi-Donor Trust amount deposited, that the deposit is made by the Donor for TF072206 (the II), and the date of the Fund for the Ethiopia General Education Quality Improvement Project a copy of the Deposit deposit (the "Deposit Instructions"). In addition, the Donor shall provide sent to Instructions to the Bank's Accounting Trust Funds Division by e-mail tfremitadvice@worldbank.org or by fax sent to +1 (202) 614-1315. or other communication 6. Except with respect to the Deposit Instructions, any notice, request by mail, to be given or made under this Administration Agreement shall be in writing and delivered at such other address as such Party fax or e-mail to the respective Party's address specified below or notifies in writing to the other Party from time to time:
For the Bank (the "Bank Contact"):
Tazeen Fasih Senior Human Development Economist AFTEE The World Bank 1818 H Street NW Washington DC Tel:+(202) 458-5461 E-mail: tfasih@worldbank.org
For the Donor (the "Donor Contact"):
Anu Eskonheimo Desk Officer Unit for Eastern and Western Africa Department for Africa and the Middle East Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland P.O. Box 541 FI-00023 Government, Finland Tel. +358 295 350000 E-mail: anu.eskonheimo(aformin.fi Agreement is subject 7. Any deposit into the Trust Fund to be made under this Administration for the fiscal year in which such to there being an annual approval by the Parliament of Finland transfer is to be made. under this Administration 8. In the event any amounts are to be returned to the Donor to the Donor's applicable donor balance account Agreement, the Bank shall transfer such amounts with the Bank, unless otherwise agreed with the Bank. 2 9. All annexes hereto constitute an integral part of this Administration Agreement, whose terms taken together shall constitute the entire agreement and understanding between the Donor and the Bank. Unless otherwise specified in an annex hereto, this Administration Agreement may be amended only by written amendment between the Bank and the Donor; provided, however, that any annexes to this Administration Agreement may be amended only by written amendment of all donors contributing to the Trust Fund.
10. The Donor shall not be responsible for the activities of any person employed by the World Bank as a result of this Administration Agreement, nor shall the Donor be liable for any costs incurred by the World Bank in terminating the engagement of any such person, except as a sole and direct result of a failure by the Donor to provide the funds committed under the Administrative Agreement.
11. Each of the undersigned represents, by confirming its acceptance below, that it is authorized Bank to enter into this Administration Agreement and act in accordance with its provisions. The and the Donor are each requested to sign and date this Administration Agreement, and upon possession by the Bank of this fully signed Administration Agreement, this Administration Agreement shall become carried out as of the date of the last signature. an 12. It is understood that this Administration Agreement, including any annexes, is not international treaty. It is an administrative agreement between the Bank and the Donor.

INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ASSQCIATION

Date: June 11, 2014
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS OF FINLAND
By: iwl
Name: df A WpV,AN CA iv
Title: _____________~~~
- Date: 3  ANNEX 1
Description of Objective and Activities Multi Donor Trust Fund for the Ethiopia General Education Quality Improvement Project II
This Annex shall be applicable to and form an integral part of all administration agreements for the Trust Fund (collectively, the "Administration Agreements" and each an "Administration Agreement") between the Bank and any entities that provide any funds to the Trust Fund (collectively, the "Donors").
1. Objectives
The objective of the General Education Quality Improvement Project II ("the Project") supported by the Trust Fund is improving learning conditions in primary and secondary schools and strengthening of institutions at different levels of educational administration. The Project constitutes the second series of Ethiopia's General Education Quality Improvement Program- GEQIP (as hereinafter defined).
2. Activities
The activities to be financed by the Trust Fund are:
2.1 Bank-executed Trust Fund component for which the Bank has implementation responsibility:
Carrying out an enhanced supervision for the management and coordination of GEQIP and the Project through, inter alia: (i) regularly monitoring the Project activities and providing progress reports to the contributing partners on implementation of Trust Fund and GEQIP at a technical and financial level, all in agreement with Ethiopia and the contributing partners; (ii) carry out jointly with the Bank and the contributing partners a mid-term review of the Trust Fund which shall cover overall progress in the implementation of the Project in meeting the objectives of the GEQIP and the results of the monitoring and evaluation; (iii) ensuring fiduciary compliance via regular financial and procurement reviews on behalf of the contributing partners and provision of no-objection letters, managing regular transactions, and ensuring timely disbursement of funds to Ethiopia.
2.2 Recipient-executed Trust Fund components for which the Recipient has implementation responsibility:
The Project constitutes the second series of GEQIP, and consists of the following parts:
Part 1: Curriculum, Textbooks, Assessment, Examinations and Inspection
Supporting General Education curriculum reform through provision of technical assistance and for, inter alia: (i) improving the quality and relevance of the curriculum; (ii) maintaining schools; increasing the supply of textbooks and supplementary reading materials for primary (iii) developing a robust national assessment and examinations system, and (iv) ensure curriculum implementation by developing an effective schools inspectorate.
4 Part 2:Teacher Development Program
(a) Enhancing the training of pre-service teachers in teacher education institutions through: (i) improved selection of entrants to teacher training; (ii) provision of teaching materials in the teacher education institutions (TEls); (iii) enhanced practicum for teacher candidates; (iv) in-service pedagogical training for teacher educators; (v) enhanced English language supports in the TEls; and (vi) provision of a training program for ABE facilitators. of (b) Improving the quality of in-service teacher training through: (i) enhancing the provision English language training for continuous professional development at Schools; (ii) providing teachers of English and developing a cadre of school-based English mentors who shall support all teachers using English as a medium of instruction; (iii) developing a teacher career structure, licensing and re-licensing system which recognizes professional development and behavior, and (iv) upgrading primary teachers from a certificate qualification to a diploma qualification.
Part 3: School Improvement Plan based on (a) Improving the capacity of Schools to identify problem areas, develop priorities prioritized needs. identified problems and prepare a School Improvement Plan to address the plans with student learning, through (i) providing training on linking school improvement schools and (ii) developing a simplified SIP framework for rural, isolated schools, smaller to strengthen ABE's, (iii) creating information campaigns for parents and communities encouraging activities community support to improved learning through the SIP's and (iv) focused specifically on reading. in Schools. (b) Provision of School Grants to improve basic teaching and learning conditions more efficient by (i) The impact of the school grants on learning outcomes will be made learning and revision of school grant guidelines to encourage use of funds for appropriate the most disadvantaged regions teaching materials, (ii) additional per capita incentives for (iv) and disadvantaged students, (iii) introduction of performance based incentives, the grievance strengthening the social accountability mechanisms and (v) strengthening and equitable redress and complaint management mechanisms to ensure efficient management of the grants.
Part 4:Management and Capacity Building, including EMIS education sector, at (a) Enhancing the capacity for strategic planning and budget analysis in the and transfer national, Regional and Woreda level, and strengthening resource allocation systems. management and (b) Enhancing the capacity for participatory school planning, leadership, monitoring to improve effectiveness and accountability in school performance. analysis and planning (c) Assisting the Ministry of Education to enhance its capacity for policy in strengthening and assisting the Ministry of Education and Regional Education Bureaus existing EMIS.
5 Part 5:Improving the Quality of Learning and Teaching through the use of Information and Communications Technology ("ICT")
(a) Developing an integrated Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning System for the ICT.
(b) Developing a national policy and institutions for ICT in general education.
(c) Developing a national ICT infrastructure improvement plan for general education through strengthening the specification, procurement, distribution and management of ICT in secondary education and developing a capacity for producing digital learning content.
(d) Teacher professional development in the use of ICT through: (i) developing an Ethiopian- relevant ICT competency framework for teachers; (ii) supporting continuing professional development and training programs for teachers; (iii) and developing a professional development and training program that encourages teachers to use technology solutions.
(e) Piloting the use of e-Braille display readers in select schools.
Part 6:Program Coordination, Monitoring and Evaluation and Communication
the (a) Strengthening the Recipient's institutional capacity for coordinating and implementing GEQIP Program at federal, Regional and Woreda levels. Project at federal, (b) Supporting the development of a monitoring and evaluation system for the Regional and Woreda levels.
3. Eligible Expenditures
3.1 For Bank-executed activities, the Trust Fund funds may be used to finance:
(a) Associated Overheads (b) Consultant Fees Individuals and Firms (c) Contractual Services (d) Equipment and Office Premises Lease Cost (e) Extended Term Consultants (f) Field Assignment Benefits (g) Media, Workshop, Conference and Meeting (h) Staff Costs - with Indirect Costs (i) Staff Costs - No Indirect Costs (j) Temporary Support Staff Costs (k) Temporary Staff Costs - No indirects (1) Travel Expenses to finance: 3.2 For Recipient-executed activities, the Trust Fund funds may be used
(a) Goods (b) Non-Consulting Services (c) Consultants' Services (d) Operating Costs (e) School Grants (f) Training
4. Taxes the financing of taxes in 4.1 The foregoing activities and categories of expenditures may include accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures.

10  ATTACHMENT Definitions
1. "ABE" means Alternative Basic Education.
2. "EMIS" means Education Management Information Systems. ABE 3. "General Education" means formal education offered at grade KGl-12 including centers in the education system of the Recipient. improve 4. "GEQIP Program" and "GEQIP" means the Recipient's strategic plan designed to referred to in a the quality of General Education throughout the Recipient's territory, as letter from the Recipient, dated November 4, 2008. Education, or any 5. "Ministry of Education" or "MoE" means the Recipient's Ministry of successor thereto. system as 6. "Region" means the second tier of government in the Recipient's administrative established under the Recipient's constitution. of any Region which 7. "Regional Education Bureau" and "REB" mean the Education Bureau is participating in the Project. (Grade KG-12) 8. "School" means a public educational institution offering General Education in the territory of the Recipient, including ABE centers. Part 3 of the Project. 9. "School Grant" means a grant proposed to be made to Schools under quality of education 10. "School Improvement Plan" or "SIP" means a plan for improving environment; (iii) focusing on inter alia: (i) teaching and learning conditions; (ii) student by a School, leadership and management of Schools; and (iv) community involvement a School Grant. prepared by a School which is seeking or has been awarded the Recipient's territory as 11.
